comment._content: .The name „Frank's cot“ at the state prison in Milledgeville refers to Leo Frank (according to: Milledgeville by Amy E. Clark-Davis, Arcadia Publishing, 2011, page 53 f., see books.google.ch/books?id=501B-QhtMisC&printsec=frontc...). Frank was accused to have murdered a 13 year old child and sentenced to death, later commuted to life imprisonment. He was arrested in Milledgeville before he was abducted and hanged by a lynch mob. „Leo Max Frank (April 17, 1884 – August 17, 1915) was a Jewish-American factory superintendent whose hanging in 1915 by a lynch mob, planned and led by prominent citizens in Marietta, Georgia, drew attention to antisemitism in the United States „ en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leo_Frank

comment._content: Leo Frank was not only accused of Murdering Mary Phagan, he was unanimously indicted for it by a Grand Jury of 21 members that included 3 Jews amongst the jurors, and convicted by a petite Trial Jury of 12 men and one judge Leonard Strickland Roan. Leo Frank appealed his sentence to every level of the United States legal system and the majority decisions and unanimous decisions left undisturbed the verdict rendered against him by 13 men. Leo Frank was not arrested in Milledgeville, he was arrested in Atlanta, Georgia. If you want to learn about the trial you can read the three major Atlanta newspaper accounts (Atlanta Journal, Atlanta Constitution and Atlanta Georgian from July and August, 1913) and Leo Frank Trial Brief of Evidence, 1913, on www.Archive.org
